I look forward with great pleasure to the visits which I shall paywith My Dear Husband to Denmark and France f and Portugal/. t amfollbwing with the closest interest the journey which My Dear Husband isnow making through many lands of the Commonwealth.2. It will remain a principal object of My ministers policy to workin close co-operation with other members of the Commonwealth and, intheir relations with foreign powers, to continue to play their full part inthe work of the United Nations /""to which they attach the highest importance/.3. f Passage on Suez to be inserted nearer the time./4. My Government welcome the widespread support in the recent discussions of the Disarmament Commission of the United Nations forthe principles which inspire their approach to the problems of inter-national disarmament, and will persist in their efforts to reach a solution which will contribute to the maintenance of enduring peace and securityamong nations.5. My Ministers will pursue their policy of developing close andintimate relations with their allies in the North Atlantic Treaty Organisa-tion and Western European Union. They will remain firm in theirresolve to develop the strength and vitality of the Atlantic Alliance whichthey regard as fundamental to the structure of international security.6. My Ministers regard as of first importance the maintenance and strengthening of close relations with the Government of the United Statesof America.7. My Government will maintain their full support for the Bagdad pact and the South East Asia Treaty Organisation in co-operation with theother members of these alliances.8. My Government will continue to work for the improvement anddevelopment of Anglo-Soviet relations.9. My Ministers will be concerned to further the progress and constitutional development of the territories of the Commonwealth for whose well-being they are responsible.19. A Bill will be introduced early in this session to grant independence to the Gold Coast under the name of "Ghana", and it is the intention ofMy Ministers that independence should take effect on 6th March, 1957.The Gold Coast Legislative Assembly have expressed the desire thatthe Gold Coast should be an independent State within the Commonwealth. 11. Orders in Council will be laid before you to provide for theconstitution of the new Esritish Caribbean Federation and for the inclusionof a number of elected members in the Legislature of British Guiana,My Government hope that it will prove possible for the delayed Conferenceon the Constitution of Nigeria to meet early in the New Year,12. My Ministers, while continuing to take the measures which areunhappily necessary to deal with terrorist activity in Cyprus, will spareno effort to find a solution to the problems of the Island, based on a new and liberal Constitution which will safeguard the rights of all communities and the essential interests of this country and our Allies.13. My Government will pursue their policy of adjusting the structure of My Forces and the organisation of home defence to changes in theworld situation in the light of scientific and technical advances, in orderthat this country may continue, in concert with My Allies, to make its full contribution in the maintenance of peace and the promotion ofeconomic stability and prosperity,14. / When the Select Committee on the Naval Discipline Act reports,My Ministers will introduce amending legislation. 715. f A measure will be laid before you to reform the composition of the House of Lords.7MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE OF COMMONS16. My Ministers will continue to strive for the collaboration ofemployers and workers in combining full employment, rising productionand stable prices. They are convinced that the wisdom and experienceof My People will be a powerful aid to them in this task, success in whichis essential to the future growth of the strength and prosperity of my country.18. It will be the aim of My Government to fortify the balance ofpayments and to extend oversea markets for our goods and services. my ministers attach great importance to increasing and strengtheningeconomic co-operation in Europe, while fostering the traditional and established Commonwealth preferential system. They are examiningpossible methods for creating a free trade area within Europe betweenthe United Kingdom and the other members of the Organisation for european Economic Co-operation in association with the Customs Unionnow being negotiated between Belgium, France, Germany, Holland,Italy and Luxembourg.19.
